item.title: IzanagiGames, Nippon TV, and AX-ON announce ‘full-scale live-action game’ AKIBA LOST for PS5, Switch 2, Switch, and PC
item.content:encoded:
IzanagiGames, in cooperation with Nippon Television Network Corporation and Nippon Television AX-ON, has announced AKIBA LOST, a “full-scale live-action game” due out for PlayStation 5, Switch 2, Switch, and PC via Steam in 2026. It will support English, Japanese, Traditional Chinese, and Simplified Chinese language options.

In Japan, pre-orders for the standard physical edition and the made-to-order Special Collection Box will begin on September 24 at 12:00 JST. AKIBA LOST will also be showcased at the IzanagiGames booth at Tokyo Game Show 2025, which will run from September 25 to 28 at Makuhari Messe in Chiba, Japan.

■ About the Game

About

With approximately 20 hours of gameplay to reach the ending, over 100,000 still images, and more than 20 hours of filmed footage, AKIBA LOST is a large-scale live-action title. Players will switch perspectives (“zapping”) between the protagonist Shinjo and six female characters to uncover the truth behind the story in this authentic multi-angle suspense game.

IzanagiGames—known for creating cinematic game experiences such as Death Come True—now teams up with Nippon TV and AX-ON, leaders in Japanese drama production, to take on the challenge of a feature-length live-action game. Starring Hiromitsu Kitayama.

Story

13 years ago, six girls mysteriously vanished in Akihabara—an unsolved case known as “Akiba’s Spirited Away.”

At the annual Game Show, Daiki Shinjo (played by Hiromitsu Kitayama), once hailed as a “genius creator,” boldly announces the development of a new game inspired by this very incident: AKIBA LOST. But the moment he does, strange disappearances begin again.

The cast of the game includes his sister Aoi Shinjo, who works at a maid cafe, underground idol Kokone Nagato, food writer Moe Kurosu, shrine maiden Chihiro Jimbo, cosplayer Wakana Yusa, and game streamer Yukimi Kurahashi—each a colorful icon of Akihabara’s vibrant subculture.

Yet, the story they were supposed to perform soon begins to bleed into reality.

It all begins with a threatening phone call—and the sudden disappearance of Aoi.

“Cancel the game’s development—or the tragedy will repeat itself.”

Can Shinjo finish developing the game? Can he protect his friends? Who is behind it all? And what really happened thirteen years ago?

The choice that determines the ending of this story is now in your hands.

Characters

  • Daiki Shinjo (portrayed by Hiromitsu Kitayama) – Game creator.
  • More characters will be revealed in the coming months.

■ Producer Comments

Shinsuke Umeda, IzanagiGames (Games: Death Come True, Yurukill: The Calumniation Games):

In June 2020, we released Death Come True under the concept of a “cinematic live-action game.” Our next ambition was to create a feature-length ensemble live-action game. Over the course of five years, we built the foundation for this project, holding countless long meetings from the very beginning together with Nippon TV and AX-ON. This collaboration has led to the creation of AKIBA LOST.

Veteran staff from the worlds of drama and film came together, filming day after day. Development continued after the shoot, and today, we are finally able to announce the project to the world.

In the story, the protagonist Shinjo strives to complete AKIBA LOST as a game creator. Similarly, Hiromitsu Kitayama, who plays Shinjo, led the team on set and helped bring this real-world version of AKIBA LOST to completion.

With the combined efforts of IzanagiGames, Nippon TV, AX-ON, the cast, and our dedicated staff, we proudly present the feature-length multi-angle suspense drama AKIBA LOST. Please look forward to it!

Hiroki Shibata, AX-ON (Dramas: Brush Up Life, What Day Were You Born On?)

As someone whose career has been in drama production, I never imagined that I would have the opportunity to work on a live-action game.

Every day, we face countless “choices.” We select one option in front of us, then move to the next… and this infinite accumulation of decisions sometimes makes us realize, “There’s no going back now.”

At the same time, in modern society there is a prevailing sense that “speed is key—make choices quickly, act, and learn through trial and error.” There is certainly some truth to this. However, even a single wrong button press can lead to irreversible consequences. That is why I wanted to craft a story themed around the choices we make in life.

In this game, you, the player, experience the lives of seven characters, face the choices that appear one after another, make decisions, and advance the story.

The protagonist is portrayed by Hiromitsu Kitayama, who is active across acting, music, and other entertainment fields. Although this was his first experience in the game world, his flexibility and passionate dedication to the project inspired us greatly.

The setting is Akihabara, Tokyo, a city renowned worldwide for its subculture. What kind of endings await based on the choices made by the game creator protagonist (you)? We hope you will experience it firsthand.

We, the team behind AKIBA LOST, are fully committed to creating a game that can become one of your life’s choices.

Hirokazu Umezawa, Nippon TV (Content Strategy Headquarters, Business Bureau, Music & Artist Center)

When I first heard about a live-action game, my immediate reaction was: “This sounds amazing!”

Although I was completely new to the world of games, I realized that this was an opportunity to leverage television’s strengths in visual direction and story structuring.

In taking on this challenge, the expertise of IzanagiGames in game production was invaluable. The result of combining television and gaming is AKIBA LOST.

Filming posed unique challenges inherent to games, but Hiromitsu Kitayama performed with remarkable skill and fully immersed himself in the role, bringing authenticity to every scene. His presence has become the “core” of this work.

AKIBA LOST is a project that could only be created because of television, and could only be completed thanks to IzanagiGames. We hope you will experience the story through your own choices!

Yushi Ito, AX-ON (Films: A Place in the Kinki Region, Your World Ends with You)

For many years, I have been creating dramas and films, portraying countless tears, smiles, and human lives. Now, I am channeling that experience into the world of games. The characters on the screen are not just characters—they have thoughts, struggles, and their futures change based on your choices. Moments will arise that shake your heart or tighten your chest.

This live-action game, crafted by specialists in drama and film production, is not confined to a scripted story. Every choice creates new scenes, weaving a story that is uniquely yours.

Hiromitsu Kitayama, who played the central role in this project, not only possesses exceptional acting skills but is also widely supported as an artist across various entertainment fields. His presence and expressiveness enrich the world of the game, making him essential to the live-action experience.

The completed AKIBA LOST is a game, yet it is also a story that allows you to experience a chapter of life. The more your emotions are engaged, the more vividly the story comes alive. We hope you will play your own drama in this world.

item.title: Ubisoft Montpellier and Ubisoft Milan “working together on the future of Rayman”
item.content:encoded:
"Rest assured, Rayman is in good hands."

Ubisoft Montpellier and Ubisoft Milan are “working together on the future of Rayman,” brand producer Loic Gounon said in a video message celebrating the series’ 30th anniversary. Rayman first launched for the original PlayStation on September 1, 1995.

“A very talented team at Ubisoft Montpellier and Ubisoft Milan are currently working together on the future of Rayman,” Gounon said. “Don’t expect news from us too soon, but rest assured, Rayman is in good hands.”

Back in October 2024, Ubisoft confirmed that Ubisoft Montpellier and Ubisoft Milan “recently started an exploration phase on the Rayman brand,” with a project “still in its early stages.” This was following a report from Insider Gaming that a Rayman remake was in early development.

More recently, in May, Ubisoft Milan posted job listings for a 3D gameplay animator and senior game designer to work on “a prestigious AAA title for the Rayman brand.”

Here is the full message from Gounon:

Hello everybody, my name is Loic [Gounon] and I’m joining you from Ubisoft Montpellier.

We are very grateful to be part of this awesome event and get the chance to talk to you, the fans, directly.

A bit about myself—I joined Ubisoft 20 years ago and I’ve been working on the Rayman franchise since 2006, on projects such as Rayman Raving Rabbids, Rayman Origins, and Rayman Legends.

Rayman was born at Ubisoft Montpellier back in 1995 and, for the past 30 years, he has gone on many adventures thanks to studios across the world like Ubisoft Paris, Ubisoft Milan, or Ubisoft Annecy.

Starting now and across our community channels, we are taking a moment to celebrate this incredible history by looking back. We will be sharing behind the scenes, anecdotes, developer interviews, concept art, and more throughout the months to come.

Rayman couldn’t have become such a legend without all of you, the fans. You’ve helped to keep his legacy growing and we’re incredibly thankful for that.

As we said in the past, a very talented team at Ubisoft Montpellier and Ubisoft Milan are currently working together on the future of Rayman. Don’t expect news from us too soon, but rest assured, Rayman is in good hands.
